briefdescription.para: Rotation of symbol may be changed during rendering and symbol should not be cached.
Flags controlling behavior of symbols during rendering.
Calculate scale by the area.
Calculate scale by the diameter.
Scale method.
Marker symbol.
Line symbol.
Fill symbol.
Hybrid symbol.
Type of the symbol.
Symbol opacity (in the range 0 - 1)
True if render has already been started - guards against multiple calls to startRender() (usually a result of not cloning a shared symbol instance before rendering).
Initialized in startRender, destroyed in stopRender.
Appends a symbol layer at the end of the current symbol layer list.

detaileddescription.para:
Ownership of layer is transferred to the symbol.
true if the layer was successfully added, false if the layer is not compatible with the symbol's type().

briefdescription.para: Returns an image of the symbol at the specified size.

detaileddescription.para: Optionally a custom render context may be given in order to ensure that the preview icon exactly matches the settings from that context.

briefdescription.para: Returns a large (roughly 100x100 pixel) preview image for the symbol.

parameterdescription.para: optional expression context, for evaluation of data defined symbol properties

briefdescription.para: Deletes the current layer at the specified index and replaces it with layer.

detaileddescription.para: Ownership of layer is transferred to the symbol.
Returns false if layer is not compatible with the symbol's type(), or true if the layer was successfully replaced.

briefdescription.para: Returns whether features drawn by the symbol will be clipped to the render context's extent.

detaileddescription.para:
If this option is enabled then features which are partially outside the extent will be clipped. This speeds up rendering of the feature, but may have undesirable side effects for certain symbol types.
true if features will be clipped
setClipFeaturesToExtent
QGIS 2.9

briefdescription.para: Returns a deep copy of this symbol.

detaileddescription.para: Ownership is transferred to the caller.

briefdescription.para: Returns the symbol's color.

detaileddescription.para: For multi-layer symbols, this method returns the color of the first unlocked symbol layer.

briefdescription.para: Removes and deletes the symbol layer at the specified index.
Draws an icon of the symbol that occupies an area given by size using the specified painter.

detaileddescription.para: Optionally a custom render context may be given in order to ensure that the preview icon exactly matches the settings from that context.

briefdescription.para: Returns a string dump of the symbol's properties.
Export the symbol as an image format, to the specified path and with the given size.

detaileddescription.para: If format is "SVG" then an SVG file will be created, otherwise a raster image of the specified format will be created.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if polygon features drawn by the symbol will be reoriented to follow the standard right-hand-rule orientation, in which the area that is bounded by the polygon is to the right of the boundary.

detaileddescription.para:
In particular, the exterior ring is oriented in a clockwise direction and the interior rings in a counter-clockwise direction.
setForceRHR()
QGIS 3.6

briefdescription.para: Returns whether the symbol utilizes any data defined properties.
Inserts a symbol layer to specified index.

detaileddescription.para:
Ownership of layer is transferred to the symbol.
index
The index at which the layer should be added
layer
The symbol layer to add
True if the layer is added, False if the index or the layer is bad

briefdescription.para: Returns the map unit scale for the symbol.

detaileddescription.para: If the symbol consists of multiple layers, the map unit scale is only returned if all layers have the same scale settings. If the settings differ, a default constructed map unit scale is returned.

briefdescription.para: Returns the opacity for the symbol.

simplesect.para: opacity value between 0 (fully transparent) and 1 (fully opaque)

briefdescription.para: Returns the units to use for sizes and widths within the symbol.

detaileddescription.para:
Individual symbol layer definitions will interpret this in different ways, e.g., a marker symbol may use it to specify the units for the marker size, while a line symbol may use it to specify the units for the line width.
output unit, or QgsUnitTypes::RenderUnknownUnit if the symbol contains mixed units
setOutputUnit()

memberdef.argsstring: (const QgsFeature &feature, QgsRenderContext &context, int layer=-1, bool selected=false, bool drawVertexMarker=false, int currentVertexMarkerType=0, int currentVertexMarkerSize=0)
memberdef.name: renderFeature

briefdescription.para: Render a feature.

detaileddescription.para: Before calling this the startRender() method should be called to initialize the rendering process. After rendering all features stopRender() must be called.

briefdescription.para: Returns the rendering hint flags for the symbol.
Sets whether features drawn by the symbol should be clipped to the render context's extent.

detaileddescription.para:
If this option is enabled then features which are partially outside the extent will be clipped. This speeds up rendering of the feature, but may have undesirable side effects for certain symbol types.
clipFeaturesToExtent
set to true to enable clipping (defaults to true)
clipFeaturesToExtent
QGIS 2.9

briefdescription.para: Sets the color for the symbol.

detaileddescription.para: Calling this method sets the color for each individual symbol layer contained within the symbol to color.
Locked symbol layers are skipped and are left unchanged.

briefdescription.para: Sets whether polygon features drawn by the symbol should be reoriented to follow the standard right-hand-rule orientation, in which the area that is bounded by the polygon is to the right of the boundary.

detaileddescription.para:
In particular, the exterior ring is oriented in a clockwise direction and the interior rings in a counter-clockwise direction.
forceRHR()
QGIS 3.6

simplesect.para: the layer will be NULL after stopRender

briefdescription.para: Sets the map unit scale for the symbol.

detaileddescription.para: Calling this method sets the scale for all symbol layers contained within the symbol.

briefdescription.para: Sets the opacity for the symbol.

parameterdescription.para: opacity value between 0 (fully transparent) and 1 (fully opaque)

briefdescription.para: Sets the units to use for sizes and widths within the symbol.

detaileddescription.para:
Individual symbol definitions will interpret this in different ways, e.g., a marker symbol may use it to specify the units for the marker size, while a line symbol may use it to specify the units for the line width.
unit
output units
outputUnit()

briefdescription.para: Sets rendering hint flags for the symbol.
Begins the rendering process for the symbol.

detaileddescription.para:
This must be called before renderFeature(), and should be followed by a call to stopRender().
context
render context which symbol will be drawn using
fields
fields for features to be rendered (usually the associated vector layer's fields). Required for correct calculation of data defined overrides.
stopRender()

briefdescription.para: Ends the rendering process.

detaileddescription.para:
This should be called after rendering all desired features.
context
render context, must match the context specified when startRender() was called.
startRender()

briefdescription.para: Returns a specific symbol layer contained in the symbol.
Returns the total number of symbol layers contained in the symbol.
Returns the list of symbol layers contained in the symbol.
Returns the symbol render context.

detaileddescription.para: Only valid between startRender and stopRender calls.

briefdescription.para: Removes a symbol layer from the list and returns a pointer to it.

detaileddescription.para:
Ownership of the layer is handed to the caller.
index
The index of the layer to remove
A pointer to the removed layer

briefdescription.para: Converts the symbol to a SLD representation.
Returns the symbol's type.
Returns a list of attributes required to render this feature.

detaileddescription.para: This should include any attributes required by the symbology including the ones required by expressions.

briefdescription.para: Returns a new default symbol for the specified geometry type.

detaileddescription.para: The caller takes ownership of the returned object.

briefdescription.para: Retrieve a cloned list of all layers that make up this symbol.

detaileddescription.para: Ownership is transferred to the caller.

briefdescription.para: Renders a context using a particular symbol layer without passing in a geometry.

detaileddescription.para: This is used as fallback, if the symbol being rendered is not compatible with the specified layer. In such a case, this method can be called and will call the layer's rendering method anyway but the geometry passed to the layer will be empty. This is required for layers that generate their own geometry from other information in the rendering context.

memberdef.argsstring: (QPointF pt, QgsRenderContext &context, int currentVertexMarkerType, int currentVertexMarkerSize)
memberdef.name: renderVertexMarker

briefdescription.para: Render editing vertex marker at specified point.
Creates a line string in screen coordinates from a QgsCurve in map coordinates.
Creates a point in screen coordinates from a QgsPoint in map coordinates.

memberdef.argsstring: (QPolygonF &pts, QList< QPolygonF > &holes, QgsRenderContext &context, const QgsPolygon &polygon, bool clipToExtent=true, bool correctRingOrientation=false)
memberdef.name: _getPolygon

briefdescription.para: Creates a polygon in screen coordinates from a QgsPolygonXYin map coordinates.

detaileddescription.para: If correctRingOrientation is true then the ring will be oriented to match standard ring orientation, e.g. clockwise for exterior rings and counter-clockwise for interior rings.

memberdef.argsstring: (QgsRenderContext &context, const QgsCurve &curve, bool clipToExtent, bool isExteriorRing=false, bool correctRingOrientation=false)
memberdef.name: _getPolygonRing

briefdescription.para: Creates a polygon ring in screen coordinates from a QgsCurve in map coordinates.

detaileddescription.para: If correctRingOrientation is true then the ring will be oriented to match standard ring orientation, e.g. clockwise for exterior rings and counter-clockwise for interior rings.

briefdescription.para: Abstract base class for all rendered symbols.
